titleInfo.title: Mary Olivia Rawls (Mills) Hoskins and Betsey Olivia Beeler

mods.abstract: Mary Olivia Rawls was born to William and Susan (Dickason) Rawls on a plantation near Commerce Landing, Mississippi on January 8, 1842. Her parents died shortly after she was born, and she was adopted by Captain John Mills and his wife. The family moved to East Tennessee, where Mary Mills attended Dr. Park's seminary in Rogersville and graduated from the East Tennessee Female Institute. She married William Patton Hoskins (1838-1902) on September 26, 1860, and the couple had seven children: Leila Susan, Nellie Temple, James Dickason, Lynn Wood, Horace Mills, Bessie Olivia, and Mary Margaret. Bessie Hoskins married Ulysses Beeler in 1897, and the couple had one child, Betsey, in 1915. Mary Rawls Mills Hoskins died in 1917 in Knoxville, Tennessee.

location.physicalLocation: University of Tennessee, Knoxville. Special Collections

titleInfo.title: Betsey B. and David D. Creekmore Collection
